item.title: 佛罗里达柑橘面临威胁，极地寒流与暴雪袭击美国东南部
item.description: 一场强劲的大西洋风暴正向美国东南部逼近，与此同时，另一股寒流正从北极南下，可能打破气温纪录，并使佛罗里达州的柑橘种植带面临毁灭性霜冻的威胁。【原文：A powerful Atlantic storm is bearing down on the Southeastern US just as another blast of Arctic air surges south, threatening to smash temperature records and putting Florida’s citrus belt at risk of a damaging freeze.】

item.title: 美国阳台太阳能推广浪潮席卷加州
item.description: 近二十个州正在考虑采用插电式太阳能系统。【原文：Nearly two dozen states are weighing plug-in solar systems.】

item.title: PG&E应对拆分计划的方案包括降低电费
item.description:
该公用事业公司首席执行官表示，人工智能带来的电力需求增长或有助于降低所有人的用电成本

【原文：

The utility’s CEO says rising electricity demand from AI could help cut costs for everyone

】

item.title: 特朗普对格陵兰的威胁危及关键气候变化研究
item.description:
政治紧张局势正阻碍着该岛的研究工作，而该岛对理解全球变暖的影响至关重要。【原文：

Political tensions are hampering work on the island, which is key to understanding the effects of global warming. 

】

item.title: 数据公司押注监管将重振气候工具市场
item.description: 为企业提供软件或服务以帮助其遵守气候法规的数据公司正争相收购竞争对手，押注新一轮监管浪潮终将扭转该行业的急剧下滑态势。【原文：Data firms that offer software or services to help companies comply with climate rules are snapping up rivals in a bet that a wave of new regulation will eventually reverse the sector’s sharp downturn.】

item.title: 欧洲每售出10辆汽车中，就有1辆来自中国品牌
item.description: 上月在欧洲销售的乘用车中，近十分之一由中国汽车制造商生产，创下历史最高份额。这一增长势头源于混合动力和纯电动汽车的强劲销售，标志着中国车企在过去一年实现了快速扩张。【原文：Chinese automakers built nearly one in 10 passenger cars sold in Europe last month, a record share that caps a year of rapid growth led by brisk sales of hybrid and battery-powered vehicles.】

item.title: 全球变暖助推南非洪灾致300人丧生
item.description: 据估计，非洲南部部分地区因极端洪水已造成约300人死亡，其中包括一场五十年一遇的洪灾。研究人员指出，气候变化加剧了这场灾难的严重程度。【原文：An estimated 300 people have died in extreme flooding across parts of southern Africa, including a one-in-50-year event that researchers said was worsened by climate change.】

item.title: 德国最高法院称必须加强气候计划以实现65%减排目标
item.description: 德国政府未能推翻柏林法院的裁决，该裁决要求政府彻底修订其2023年气候计划，以实现2030年各行业具体设定的减排目标。【原文：The German government lost its bid to overturn a Berlin court ruling that ordered it to overhaul its 2023 climate program to meet sector-specific targets for 2030.】

item.title: 特朗普的贸易攻势不会促使欧盟更接近中国，霍克斯特拉表示
item.description: 欧盟气候事务负责人表示，欧盟必须抵制中国在清洁技术领域的吸引力，即便其面临着与美国关系恶化可能"永久化"的现实。【原文：The European Union must resist China’s pull in clean technologies, even as it confronts the reality that deteriorating relations with the US may be “permanent,” according to the bloc’s climate chief.】

item.title: 为降低电费开支，消费者悄然安装自制太阳能设备
item.description:
在德国广受欢迎的"插电式太阳能"在美国却鲜为人知，主要原因在于该领域缺乏监管。近期多州出台的立法旨在推动其普及应用。【原文：

Popular in Germany, “plug-in solar” has remained in the shadows in the US because it’s largely unregulated. Legislation recently introduced in many states aims to promote adoption.

】

item.title: 新沿海风暴形成，科德角面临最高降雪风险
item.description: 纽约及东北部大部分地区本周末或将免受新一轮冬季风暴最严重影响，但该风暴北移过程中仍可能影响科德角和新英格兰东部地区，此前其已导致北卡罗来纳州和弗吉尼亚州部分地区天气恶化。【原文：New York and most of the Northeast will likely be spared the worst of a new winter storm this weekend that still may clip Cape Cod and eastern New England after also making conditions worse across parts of North Carolina and Virginia as it travels north.】

item.title: 美国电动汽车车主拥有丰富的快速充电选项
item.description: 今日《绿色日报》还报道：中国最新绿色金融数据，以及靠工业级电池发家致富的亿万富翁。【原文：Also in today’s Green Daily newsletter: China’s latest green finance numbers and the billionaire who made a fortune on industrial-scale batteries.】

item.title: 印度预计最早2028年启动绿色氨出口
item.description: 印度可再生能源部秘书桑托什·库马尔·萨兰吉表示，印度计划最早于2028年开始向海外出口绿色氨，这将推动该国成为全球清洁氢及其衍生物枢纽的雄心壮志。【原文：India plans to start shipping green ammonia overseas as early as 2028, according to Renewable Energy Secretary Santosh Kumar Sarangi, a boost to the nation’s ambition to become a global hub for clean hydrogen and its derivatives.】

item.title: 中国6.8万亿美元绿色金融热潮有望进一步发展
item.description: 据中国央行前顾问称，过去十年间中国绿色金融领域发展加速，目前资金规模已达约6.8万亿美元。【原文：Growth in China’s green finance sector has accelerated over the past decade and balances now total about $6.8 trillion, according to a former adviser to the nation’s central bank.】

item.title: 私募市场为能源转型筹集近2300亿美元资金
item.description: 据彭博新能源财经数据显示，过去十年间，私募市场为能源转型基金筹集了近2300亿美元资金，为清洁能源及其他可再生能源项目创造了日益增长的融资来源。【原文：Private markets raised almost $230 billion for energy-transition funds over the past decade, creating a growing source of financing for clean energy and other renewable projects, according to BloombergNEF.】

item.title: 研究发现东南亚洪灾损失或激增十倍
item.description: 威立雅塔沃斯公司表示，由于极端天气事件增多，未来几年东南亚洪水造成的损失可能增加10倍。【原文：Losses tied to floods in Southeast Asia may grow as much as 10-fold in the coming years due to the rise of extreme weather events, according to Willis Towers Watson Plc.】

item.title: 澳大利亚锂矿商在价格上涨后考虑增产
item.description: 澳大利亚两家最大的锂矿商正考虑扩大产量，以把握这种电池金属强劲上涨的机遇。【原文：Two of Australia’s biggest lithium miners are considering ramping up production to take advantage of a powerful rally in the battery metal.】

item.title: 乔治·桑德斯论气候内疚、人工智能与批判性思维
item.description:
这位布克奖得主在其新作《守夜》中，将目光投向气候变化与一位石油高管临终前的思绪。

【原文：

The Booker-Prize winning writer turns to climate change and the dying thoughts of an oil executive in his new novel Vigil

】

item.description:
一位鲜为人知的中国清洁能源亿万富翁即将登上全球舞台。【原文：

A largely unknown Chinese clean-energy billionaire is about to step into the global spotlight

】

item.title: 美国家庭面临数年最高能源账单，正面临艰难抉择
item.description:
从纽约到弗吉尼亚，居民们正关闭供暖和电力以节省开支，尽管气温已骤降至严寒。【原文：

From New York to Virginia, residents are turning off heat and electricity to save money even as temperatures turn frigid.

】

item.title: 特朗普否决拜登时期向亚利桑那州公用事业公司提供的18亿美元清洁能源贷款
item.description: 美国能源部表示，在对前总统乔·拜登政府时期发放的贷款进行审查后，已取消多项项目，其中包括向亚利桑那州一家公用事业公司提供18亿美元贷款担保以部署清洁能源的项目。【原文：A $1.8 billion loan guarantee to an Arizona utility to deploy clean energy are among the projects the Energy Department has canceled following a review of loans made during former President Joe Biden’s administration, according to the department.】

item.title: 谷歌以60亿美元估值投资特斯拉联合创始人创立的红木资本
item.description: 红木材料公司（Redwood Materials Inc.）在扩大融资轮中新增谷歌母公司字母表公司（Alphabet Inc.）作为投资者，此次融资使这家电池回收与储能初创企业的估值突破60亿美元。【原文：Redwood Materials Inc. added Alphabet Inc.’s Google as an investor in an expanded funding round that values the battery recycling and energy storage startup at more than $6 billion.】

item.title: 美国新增11,300个超快充电器，力图吸引更多电动车主
item.description:
尽管联邦电动汽车激励政策已终止，但更快的充电速度可能促使更多驾驶者转向电动汽车。

【原文：

Faster charging may nudge more drivers to go electric despite the end of federal EV incentives. 

】

item.title: 马德里因罕见降雪关闭部分学校、道路及列车
item.description: 马德里迎来一场突如其来的暴风雪，导致部分学校、道路和铁路线路关闭，空中交通也受到影响。这场名为克里斯汀的暴风雪席卷伊比利亚半岛，让这座不习惯恶劣天气的城市措手不及。【原文：Madrid woke up to a snow flurry that led some schools, roads and train lines to close and the air traffic to slow down in a city that’s not used to inclement weather, as storm Kristin barrels across the Iberian Peninsula.】

item.title: 川崎重工董事长加码液态氢贸易
item.description: 川崎重工业株式会社董事长表示，该公司正推进液态氢供应链计划，印度可能是潜在供应来源。【原文：Kawasaki Heavy Industries Ltd. is moving ahead with plans for a liquefied hydrogen supply chain, with India as a potential source, according to its chairman.】

item.title: SK创新称与福特终止电池合作致其损失26亿美元
item.description: SK创新公司表示，终止与福特汽车公司在美国的电池合资项目导致3.7万亿韩元（约合26亿美元）资产损失，全球电动汽车扩张计划的收缩成本正波及整个供应链。【原文：SK Innovation Co. said the termination of a battery joint venture with Ford Motor Co. in the US resulted in a 3.7 trillion won ($2.6 billion) asset loss, as the cost of a pullback in global electric vehicle ambitions ripples through the supply chain.】

item.title: 中国四年能源扩张规模已超越整个美国电网
item.description: 中国正掀起一场前所未有的能源建设热潮，北京方面力图确保为那些对电力需求旺盛的设施提供充足供应——这些设施对主导未来新兴产业至关重要。【原文：China is undertaking an energy-building boom unlike anything the world has ever seen, as Beijing seeks to ensure supply for power-hungry facilities that are key to dominating emerging industries of the future.】

item.title: 中国电动卡车热潮对液化天然气需求构成新威胁
item.description: 中国电动卡车的快速普及——去年其销量首次超越燃油车——正威胁着该国化石燃料供应商的关键需求来源。【原文：China’s rapid adoption of electric trucks — which overtook gas-powered vehicle sales for the first time last year — is threatening a key source of demand for the country’s suppliers of the fossil fuel.】

item.title: 随着核能计划推进，印度或将订购更多国产反应堆
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度计划订购第三批本土设计的核反应堆，作为一项雄心勃勃的努力的一部分，旨在以可控成本扩大核电产能。【原文：India is set to order a third fleet of locally designed reactors as part of an ambitious effort to expand nuclear power capacity at a manageable cost, according to people familiar with the plan.】
